name: amazon_supply_chain.fba_list_replenish_asap
description:
List items that need to be replenished to FBA ASAP based on projected stockout risk and inbound coverage.

Before calling this tool:
1) Ask the user which filters/parameters they want to use (do not assume).
2) Explicitly tell the user which parameters are available and what the recommended defaults are.
3) Offer to open/read the supporting documentation and the NeonPanel Inventory Planning report.

Knowledge base (methodology & definitions): https://help.neonpanel.com/en/articles/60
Inventory Planning report (UI): https://my.neonpanel.com/app/reports/forecasting/inventory-planning

Recommended defaults (confirm with user):
- sku_selector.planning_base: actively_sold_only
- time_window.lookahead_days: 14
- sales_velocity: current
- use_seasonality: true
- override_default: false (so table defaults are used)
- stockout_threshold_days: 7
- limit: 200

Common questions to ask the user:
- Which marketplaces/countries should we include? (default: ALL)
- Do you want actively sold only (default), all, or a targeted subset?
- Do you want to override lead time / safety stock days, or use system defaults?
- Should results be limited to a specific company_id (if you have multiple)?

planning_base.description:
Which universe of SKUs/items to consider. Ask the user to choose one. Recommended default: actively_sold_only.
- actively_sold_only: only actively sold items
- all: consider all items
- targeted_only: only explicitly targeted items (provide target_* filters)
- planned_only: only items in plan

target_skus.description: Optional. Use when you want to target specific SKUs. Recommended when planning_base=targeted_only.

target_inventory_ids.description: Optional. Use when you want to target specific inventory IDs. Recommended when planning_base=targeted_only.

target_asins.description: Optional. Use when you want to target specific ASINs. Recommended when planning_base=targeted_only.

brand.description: Optional. Brand filter (exact match as stored in snapshot).

category.description: Optional. Category filter (exact match as stored in snapshot).

marketplaces.description: Marketplace filter. Recommended default: ["ALL"]. If you provide both "ALL" and specific marketplaces (e.g. ["ALL","UK"]), "ALL" is ignored and the specific marketplaces are used. If you set countries, countries takes precedence over marketplaces. Note: the snapshot uses country labels like "United Kingdom"/"United States"; the tool maps UK/US automatically.

countries.description: Optional: explicit country/marketplace filter (Athena: pil.country). If provided, this takes precedence over marketplaces.

company_id.description: Optional: restrict to a specific company_id (must be permitted for the caller). Recommended default: omit (use all permitted companies).

lookahead_days.description: How many days ahead to evaluate stockout risk. Recommended default: 14. Ask the user if they want a different horizon (e.g., 7/14/30).

as_of_date.description: Optional. Evaluate as of a specific date (YYYY-MM-DD). If omitted, the latest available snapshot date is used.

time_window.description: Time window settings. Ask the user to confirm lookahead_days and (optionally) as_of_date.

sales_velocity.description: Which sales velocity to use for projections. Recommended default: current.

use_seasonality.description: Whether to apply seasonality adjustments (if available in the snapshot). Recommended default: true.

override_default.description: If true, use fba_lead_time_days_override and fba_safety_stock_days_override instead of table defaults.

fba_lead_time_days_override.description: Only used when override_default=true. Lead time (days) to use for FBA replenishment planning. Recommended default: 12 (confirm with user).

fba_safety_stock_days_override.description: Only used when override_default=true. Safety stock (days) to use for FBA replenishment planning. Recommended default: 60 (confirm with user).

limit.description: Max number of rows to return. Recommended default: 200.

stockout_threshold_days.description: Threshold (days to OOS) for classifying urgency. Recommended default: 7.

active_sold_min_units_per_day.description: Only affects sku_selector.planning_base=actively_sold_only. Minimum average daily units (30-day basis) required to include an item as 'actively sold'. Default 0.0333333333 â‰ˆ 1 unit sold in the last 30 days. Example: 100 means only items selling ~100/day or more are considered actively sold.

item_ref.description: Canonical item reference. Include at least one identifier. Prefer to include item_icon_url in tool outputs to avoid extra requests.

item_icon_url.description: Small icon/image URL for item; include in datasets when possible.

examples.name: Recommended defaults (broad)
examples.description: Use recommended defaults and all marketplaces.

examples.name: Targeted SKUs (US only)
examples.description: Target a small SKU list and restrict to US.
